markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 4+"
    pfs=""
>
[Bag of Holding](/Equipment.aspx?ID=249)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Extradimensional" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=67" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 572 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a _bag of holding_ opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the _bag of holding_ itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

 You can Interact with the _bag of holding_ to stow items in it or remove them just like a mundane [sack](/Equipment.aspx?ID=45). Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

 If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 4"
pfs="Standard"
>
Bag of Holding (Type I)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 572 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 75 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

**Capacity** 25 Bulk

<title
level="2"
right="Item 7"
pfs="Standard"
>
Bag of Holding (Type II)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 572 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 300 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

**Capacity** 50 Bulk

<title
level="2"
right="Item 11"
pfs="Standard"
>
Bag of Holding (Type III)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 572 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 1,200 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

**Capacity** 100 Bulk

<title
level="2"
right="Item 13"
pfs="Standard"
>
Bag of Holding (Type IV)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 572 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 2,400 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

**Capacity** 150 Bulk
name: Bag of Holding (Type I)
